p: Dihydrolipoamide dehydrogenase, an E3 member of the PDH complex, is a virulence factor since a mutant of dihydrolipoamide dehydrogenase has demonstrated significant attenuation of M. gallisepticum virulence in vivo [ 252]. The dihydrolipoamide dehydrogenase gene has also been identified in M. genitalium, M. bovis, M. capricolum, and Mccp [ 78, 232, 253, 254].
